data.title: Shahid turns 7, Scam 1992 star Pratik Gandhi has a priceless comment for Hansal Mehta
data.meta_description: Rajkummar Rao and Hansal Mehta won the National Award for Best Actor and Best Director respectively for Shahid.
data.text:
Director Hansal Mehta’s film Shahid, which won many accolades including the National Award, turned 7 on Sunday. On the special day, the director shared 10 photos from his critically acclaimed film and captioned it, “7 years of #Shahid.” Hansal’s fans and friends congratulated him in the comments section. We also spotted a comment by Scam 1992 star Pratik Gandhi, who wrote, “ Congratulations sir, this was a master piece (sic).” Scam 1992 is Hansal Mehta-directed web-series which stars Pratik Gandhi in the lead role. The series is based on 1992 Indian stock market scam which was committed by stockbroker Harshad Mehta.

advertisement

Take a look at Hansal Mehta’s post here:

Jointly produced by Anurag Kashyap, UTV Spotboy and Sunil Bohra, actor Rajkummar Rao played the titular role in the film. Hansal Mehta’s movie was based on the real life story of lawyer and human rights activist Shahid Azmi, who was assassinated in 2010. Rajkummar received rave reviews for his role in the film. Though Shahid appealed to a very small section of movie goers, this did not stop him from winning the National Award for this role. Shahid premiered at several international film festivals including the 2012 Toronto International Film Festival, the Dubai International Film Festival and the Chicago South Asian Film Festival.

Shahid was Rajkummar Rao’s first collaboration with Hansal Mehta. The actor-director duo collaborated in many films thereafter including Omerta, Aligarh and CityLights. The 2013 film also starred Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, Prabhleen Sandhu and Baljinder Kaur.
